00015 int CObject::m_number_of_objects = 0; // The current number of total objects we have within the game!
00016 
00017 ///
00018 // Initialization Routine
00019 ///
00020 CObject::CObject(CMap *pmap, Uint32 x, Uint32 y, object_t type) :
00021 m_type(type),
00022 m_index(m_number_of_objects),
00023 HealthPoints(1),
00024 sprite(BLANKSPRITE),
00025 mp_object(NULL),
00026 mp_Map(pmap),
00027 m_blinktime(0),
00028 m_invincible(false)
00029 {
00030  bboxX1 = 0;
00031  bboxX2 = 0;
00032  bboxY1 = 0;
00033  bboxY2 = 0;
00034  falling = false;
00035  m_number_of_objects++;
00036  exists = true;
00037  solid = true;
00038  inhibitfall = false;
00039 
00040  this->x = x;
00041  this->y = y;
00042  canbezapped = false;
00043  onscreen = false;
00044 
00045  cansupportplayer = false;
00046  
00047     yinertia = 0;
00048  xinertia = 0;
00049 
00050  scrx = scry = 0;
00051  dead = false;
00052  hasbeenonscreen = false;
00053  honorPriority = true;
00054  dontdraw = false;
00055  touchPlayer = touchedBy = 0;
00056  cansupportplayer = false;
00057  dying = false;
00058  m_ActionBaseOffset = 0x0;
00059  m_direction = NONE;
00060  m_ActionTicker = 0;
00061  m_canturnaround = false;
00062 
00063  if(m_type != OBJ_NONE )
00064  {
00065   setupObjectType(g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode());
00066 
00067   performCollisions(true);
00068  }
00069 }
00070 
00071 void CObject::setupObjectType(int Episode)
00072 {
00073  switch(m_type)
00074  {
00075  // Mainly Episode 1
00076  case OBJ_GARG: sprite = OBJ_GARG_DEFSPRITE; break;
00077  case OBJ_BUTLER: sprite = OBJ_BUTLER_DEFSPRITE; break;
00078  case OBJ_TANK: sprite = OBJ_BUTLER_DEFSPRITE; break;
00079  case OBJ_ICECHUNK: sprite = OBJ_ICECHUNK_DEFSPRITE; break;
00080  case OBJ_ICEBIT: sprite = OBJ_ICEBIT_DEFSPRITE; break;
00081  case OBJ_ICECANNON: sprite = OBJ_ICECHUNK_DEFSPRITE; break;
00082  case OBJ_ROPE: sprite = OBJ_ROPE_DEFSPRITE; break;
00083 
00084  // Mainly Episode 2
00085  case OBJ_SCRUB: sprite = OBJ_SCRUB_DEFSPRITE; break;
00086  case OBJ_GUARDROBOT: sprite = OBJ_TANKEP2_DEFSPRITE; break;
00087  case OBJ_VORTELITE: sprite = OBJ_VORTELITE_DEFSPRITE; break;
00088  case OBJ_SPARK: sprite = OBJ_SPARK_DEFSPRITE_EP2; break;
00089 
00090  // Mainly Episode 3
00091  case OBJ_FOOB: sprite = OBJ_FOOB_DEFSPRITE; break;
00092  case OBJ_NINJA: sprite = OBJ_NINJA_DEFSPRITE; break;
00093  case OBJ_MOTHER: sprite = OBJ_MOTHER_DEFSPRITE; break;
00094  case OBJ_MEEP: sprite = OBJ_MEEP_DEFSPRITE; break;
00095  case OBJ_BALL: sprite = OBJ_BALL_DEFSPRITE; break;
00096  case OBJ_JACK: sprite = OBJ_JACK_DEFSPRITE; break;
00097  case OBJ_MESSIE: sprite = OBJ_NESSIE_DEFSPRITE; break;
00098  case OBJ_AUTORAY_V: sprite = RAY_VERT_EP3; break;
00099  case OBJ_SNDWAVE: sprite = OBJ_SNDWAVE_DEFSPRITE; break;
00100 
00101  case OBJ_VORT:
00102   {
00103    if(Episode == 1) sprite = OBJ_VORT_DEFSPRITE_EP1;
00104    else if(Episode == 2) sprite = OBJ_VORT_DEFSPRITE_EP2;
00105    else if(Episode == 3) sprite = OBJ_VORT_DEFSPRITE_EP3;
00106   }break;
00107 
00108  case OBJ_BABY:
00109  {
00110   if(Episode == 2) sprite = OBJ_BABY_DEFSPRITE_EP2;
00111   else sprite = OBJ_BABY_DEFSPRITE_EP3;
00112  }break;
00113 
00114  case OBJ_PLATFORM:
00115  case OBJ_PLATVERT:
00116  {
00117   if(Episode == 2) sprite = OBJ_PLATFORM_DEFSPRITE_EP2;
00118   else sprite = OBJ_PLATFORM_DEFSPRITE_EP3;
00119  }break;
00120 
00121 
00122  case OBJ_AUTORAY: {
00123   if(Episode == 1) sprite = ENEMYRAY;
00124   else if(Episode == 2) sprite = ENEMYRAYEP2;
00125   sprite = ENEMYRAYEP3;
00126  }break;
00127 
00128  case OBJ_DOOR: sprite = DOOR_YELLOW_SPRITE; break;
00129  case OBJ_TELEPORTER: sprite = OBJ_TELEPORTER_DEFSPRITE; break;
00130  case OBJ_SECTOREFFECTOR: sprite = BLANKSPRITE; break;
00131  case OBJ_GOTPOINTS: sprite = PT500_SPRITE; break;
00132  default: sprite = BLANKSPRITE;
00133  }
00134 
00135 }

00137 /*
00138  * \brief performs collision without bouncing box recalculation
00139  */
00140 void CObject::performCollisionsSameBox()
00141 {
00142  // Left/Right borders
00143  blockedl = checkSolidL(x+bboxX1, x+bboxX2, y+bboxY1, y+bboxY2);
00144  blockedr = checkSolidR(x+bboxX1, x+bboxX2, y+bboxY1, y+bboxY2);
00145 
00146  // Upper/Lower borders
00147  blockedu = checkSolidU(x+bboxX1, x+bboxX2, y+bboxY1);
00148  blockedd = checkSolidD(x+bboxX1, x+bboxX2, y+bboxY2);
00149 
00150  if(g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() > 3)
00151  { // now check for the sloped tiles
00152   performCollisionOnSlopedTiles();
00153  }
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*
00157  * \brief Calculate Bouncing Boxes
00158  */
00159 void CObject::calcBouncingBoxes(bool firsttime)
00160 {
00161  CSprite &rSprite = g_pGfxEngine->getSprite(sprite);
00162 
00163  const int diff_y =  bboxY2==0 ? 0 :(int)bboxY2-(int)rSprite.m_bboxY2;
00164 
00165  bboxX1 = rSprite.m_bboxX1;
00166  bboxX2 = rSprite.m_bboxX2;
00167  bboxY1 = rSprite.m_bboxY1;
00168  bboxY2 = rSprite.m_bboxY2;
00169 
00170  if(!firsttime && g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() > 3)
00171   moveYDir(diff_y);
00172 }
00173 
00174 /*
00175  * This function determines if the object is touching a sloped tile
00176  * and determine the collisions
00177  */
00178 const int COLISION_RES = (1<<STC);
00179 void CObject::performCollisionOnSlopedTiles()
00180 {
00181  const Uint32 halftile = ((1<<CSF)/2);
00182  const Uint32 x1 = x + bboxX1;
00183  const Uint32 x2 = x + bboxX2;
00184  const Uint32 y2 = y + bboxY2;
00185  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00186  onslope = false;
00187 
00188  for(Uint32 c=y2-halftile ; c<=y2+halftile ; c += COLISION_RES)
00189  {
00190   char block;
00191   block = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x1>>CSF, c>>CSF)].bup;
00192   if( block >= 2 && block <= 7 )
00193   {
00194    onslope = true;
00195    break;
00196   }
00197   block = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x2>>CSF, c>>CSF)].bup;
00198   if( block >= 2 && block <= 7 )
00199   {
00200    onslope = true;
00201    break;
00202   }
00203  }
00204 
00205  if(!onslope)
00206  {
00207   for(Uint32 c=x1 ; c<=x2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
00208   {
00209    char block;
00210    block = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(c>>CSF, (y2+halftile)>>CSF)].bup;
00211    if( block >= 2 && block <= 7 )
00212    {
00213     onslope = true;
00214     break;
00215    }
00216   }
00217  }
00218 
00219  if(onslope)
00220  {
00221   blockedr = blockedl = false;
00222 
00223   pushOutofSolidTiles();
00224  }
00225 }
00226 
00227 /**
00228  * So far only used in Galaxy. This is the code for sloped tiles downside
00229  * This is performed when Keen walks into a sloped tile
00230  *
00231  * 0 Fall through  1 Flat
00232  * 2 Top -> Middle  3 Middle -> bottom
00233  * 4 Top -> bottom  5 Middle -> top
00234  * 6 Bottom -> middle 7 Bottom -> top
00235  * 8 Unused   9 Deadly, can't land on in God mode
00236  */
00237 void getSlopePointsLowerTile(char slope, int &yb1, int &yb2)
00238 {
00239  // Calculate the corner y coordinates
00240  if( slope == 2 )
00241   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 256;
00242  else if( slope == 3 )
00243   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 512;
00244  else if( slope == 4 )
00245   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 512;
00246  else if( slope == 5 )
00247   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 0;
00248  else if( slope == 6 )
00249   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 256;
00250  else if( slope == 7 )
00251   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 0;
00252  else
00253   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 0;
00254 }
00255 
00256 void CObject::pushOutofSolidTiles()
00257 {
00258  if(onslope)
00259  {
00260   const int px= (x+(bboxX1+bboxX2)/2);
00261   const int py= (y+bboxY2+1);
00262   std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00263   const char slope = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(px>>CSF, py>>CSF)].bup;
00264 
00265   // Now, if Keen is standing in a sloped tile, try to push him out
00266   if(slope)
00267   {
00268    int yb1, yb2;
00269    getSlopePointsLowerTile(slope, yb1, yb2);
00270    const int dy = ((yb2-yb1)*(px%512))/512;
00271    const int yh = yb1 + dy;
00272 
00273    if( py%512 > yh )
00274     y -= ((py%512) - yh);
00275   }
00276  }
00277 }
00278 
00279 /*
00280  * \brief This checks the collision. Very simple pixel based algorithm
00281  *     The collision is per pixel-based
00282  */
00283 void CObject::performCollisions(bool firsttime)
00284 {
00285  blockedr = blockedl = false;
00286  blockedu = blockedd = false;
00287 
00288  if ( sprite != BLANKSPRITE )
00289  {
00290   calcBouncingBoxes(firsttime);
00291   performCollisionsSameBox();
00292  }
00293 }
00294 
00295 void CObject::setScrPos( int px, int py )
00296 {
00297  scrx = px;
00298  scry = py;
00299 }
00300 
00301 // This functions checks, if the enemy is near to the player. In case, that it is
00302 // it will return true. Other case it will return false.
00303 // This used for objects that only can trigger, when it's really worth to do so.
00304 bool CObject::calcVisibility()
00305 {
00306  int &visibility = g_pBehaviorEngine->getPhysicsSettings().misc.visibility;
00307 
00308  // Platform are always active
00309  if(m_type == OBJ_PLATFORM || m_type == OBJ_PLATVERT) return true;
00310 
00311  SDL_Rect gameres = g_pVideoDriver->getGameResolution();
00312 
00313  Uint32 left = (((mp_Map->m_scrollx<<STC)-(visibility<<CSF))<0) ? 0 :
00314        (mp_Map->m_scrollx<<STC)-(visibility<<CSF);
00315  Uint32 right = ((mp_Map->m_scrollx+gameres.w)<<STC)+(visibility<<CSF);
00316  Uint32 up = (((mp_Map->m_scrolly<<STC)-(visibility<<CSF))<0) ? 0 :
00317        (mp_Map->m_scrolly<<STC)-(visibility<<CSF);
00318  Uint32 down = ((mp_Map->m_scrolly+gameres.h)<<STC)+(visibility<<CSF);
00319 
00320  bool inscreen = ( right > x && left < x && down > y && up < y );
00321 
00322  // Bullets should disappear when offscreen
00323  if(m_type == OBJ_SNDWAVE || m_type == OBJ_RAY || m_type == OBJ_FIREBALL)
00324   if(!inscreen)
00325    exists=false;
00326 
00327  return inscreen;
00328 }
00329 
00330 /**
00331  * This function will check if the enemy is in the limited scenario,
00332  * so it will triggered. Happens normally when the Object is seen on the screen.
00333  */
00334 bool CObject::checkforScenario()
00335 {
00336  if ( !exists || m_type==OBJ_PLAYER ) return false;
00337 
00338  if( m_type==OBJ_EXPLOSION || m_type==OBJ_EARTHCHUNK
00339    || m_type == OBJ_BRIDGE || m_type == OBJ_NONE ) return true;
00340 
00341  // Check if enemy is near enough. If he isn't, don't make him perform. Exception is on the map
00342  if(!mp_Map->m_worldmap)
00343   if(!calcVisibility()) return false;
00344 
00345     onscreen = true;
00346 
00347     if (hasbeenonscreen ||
00348   m_type==OBJ_RAY || m_type==OBJ_ROPE ||
00349   m_type==OBJ_ICECANNON ||
00350   m_type==OBJ_ICECHUNK || m_type==OBJ_PLATFORM ||
00351   m_type==OBJ_PLATVERT || m_type==OBJ_YORP ||
00352   m_type==OBJ_FOOB || m_type==OBJ_SCRUB ||
00353   m_type == OBJ_SECTOREFFECTOR)
00354  {
00355   return true;
00356     }
00357 
00358     return false;
00359 }
00360 
00361 // Basic slope move independent of the left or right move
00362 void CObject::moveSlopedTiles( int x, int y1, int y2, int xspeed )
00363 {
00364  // process the sloped tiles here. Galaxy only or special patch!!
00365  if(g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() > 3)
00366  {
00367   if(!moveSlopedTileDown(x, y2, xspeed))
00368    moveSlopedTileUp(x, y1, xspeed);
00369  }
00370 }
00371 
00372 
00373 bool CObject::moveSlopedTileDown( int x, int y, int xspeed )
00374 {
00375  if(yinertia<0)
00376   return false;
00377 
00378  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00379 
00380  const char slope = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x>>CSF, y>>CSF)].bup;
00381 
00382  // Check first, if there is a tile on players level
00383  if( slope >=2 && slope<=7 )
00384  {
00385   int yb1, yb2;
00386   getSlopePointsLowerTile(slope, yb1, yb2);
00387 
00388   // Get relative position of the X corner
00389   const int L = 512;
00390   const int x_r = (x%L);
00391 
00392   // get the dy position so the new pos can be computed
00393   int dy = ((yb2-yb1)*x_r)/L;
00394 
00395   // get the new position of the lower corner
00396   const int y_rel = yb1 + dy;
00397 
00398   // Get the upper border pos if the tile
00399   int y_csf;
00400   y_csf = (y>>CSF)<<CSF;
00401 
00402   // Get the new lower corner pos
00403   const int y_pos = y_csf + y_rel;
00404 
00405   // get new position
00406   Uint32 new_y;
00407 
00408   // Now we have to see all the cases for sloped tiles of an object
00409   // when going right...
00410   if(xspeed > 0)
00411   {
00412    new_y = y_pos - bboxY2;
00413    if( x_r >= 480 && ( yb1>yb2 ) ) // At Tile edge
00414    {
00415     new_y = (new_y>>CSF)<<CSF;
00416     dy = this->y - (new_y+yb2);
00417     moveUp( dy );
00418     moveRight( dy );
00419 
00420    }
00421    else // In the Tile itself or walking into...
00422    {
00423     moveYDir( new_y - this->y );
00424    }
00425   }
00426   else if(xspeed < 0) // Going left
00427   {
00428    new_y = y_pos - bboxY2;
00429    if( x_r <= 32 && ( yb1<yb2 ) ) // At Tile edge
00430    {
00431     new_y = (new_y>>CSF)<<CSF;
00432     dy = (new_y+yb1) - this->y;
00433     moveYDir( dy );
00434     moveLeft( dy );
00435    }
00436    else // In the Tile itself or walking into...
00437    {
00438     moveYDir( new_y - this->y );
00439    }
00440   }
00441   return true;
00442  }
00443  else
00444   return false;
00445 }
00446 
00447 /**
00448  * So far only used in Galaxy. This is the code for sloped tiles upside
00449  *
00450  * 0 Jump through  1 Flat bottom
00451  * 2 Bottom-> Middle  3 Middle -> top
00452  * 4 Bottom -> top  5 Middle -> bottom
00453  * 6 Top -> middle  7 Top -> bottom
00454  *
00455  */
00456 void CObject::moveSlopedTileUp( int x, int y, int xspeed )
00457 {
00458  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00459  char slope = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x>>CSF, y>>CSF)].bdown;
00460 
00461  // Let's calculate the exact Y-Coordinate and put the object there...
00462 
00463  // Calculate the corner y coordinates
00464  int yb1, yb2;
00465 
00466  if( slope == 2 )
00467   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 256;
00468  else if( slope == 3 )
00469   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 0;
00470  else if( slope == 4 )
00471   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 0;
00472  else if( slope == 5 )
00473   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 512;
00474  else if( slope == 6 )
00475   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 256;
00476  else if( slope == 7 )
00477   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 512;
00478  else
00479   return;
00480 
00481  // Get the upper border pos if the tile
00482  const int y_csf = (y>>CSF)<<CSF;
00483 
00484  // Get relative position of the X corner
00485  const int L = 512;
00486  const int x_r = (x%L);
00487 
00488  // get the dy position so the new pos can be computed
00489  int dy = ((yb2-yb1)*x_r)/L;
00490 
00491  // get the new position of the lower corner
00492  const int y_rel = yb1 + dy;
00493 
00494  // Get the new lower corner pos
00495  const int y_pos = y_csf + y_rel;
00496 
00497  // get new position
00498  const Uint32 new_y = y_pos - bboxY1 + (1<<STC);
00499  moveYDir( new_y - this->y );
00500 }
00501 
00502 // Used in some setup mode, like putting the player to
00503 // the current map position
00504 void CObject::moveToForce(int new_x, int new_y)
00505 {
00506  bool laststate = solid;
00507 
00508  solid = false;
00509  moveTo(new_x, new_y);
00510  solid = laststate;
00511 }
00512 
00513 // For the vector functions
00514 void CObject::moveDir(const VectorD2<int> &dir)
00515 {
00516  moveXDir(dir.x);
00517  moveYDir(dir.y);
00518 }
00519 
00520 void CObject::moveTo(const VectorD2<Uint32> &new_loc)
00521 {
00522  moveTo(new_loc.x, new_loc.y);
00523 }
00524 
00525 void CObject::moveTo(int new_x, int new_y)
00526 {
00527  int amount_x = new_x-x;
00528  int amount_y = new_y-y;
00529 
00530  if(amount_x < 0) // move left
00531   moveLeft(-amount_x);
00532  else if(amount_x > 0) // move right
00533   moveRight(amount_x);
00534 
00535  if(amount_y < 0) // means up
00536   moveUp(-amount_y);
00537  else if(amount_y > 0) // means down
00538   moveDown(amount_y);
00539 }
00540 
00541 void CObject::moveXDir(int amount, bool force)
00542 {
00543  if(amount<0)
00544   moveLeft(-amount, force);
00545  else if(amount>0)
00546   moveRight(amount, force);
00547 }
00548 void CObject::moveYDir(int amount)
00549 {
00550  if(amount<0)
00551   moveUp(-amount);
00552  else if(amount>0)
00553   moveDown(amount);
00554 }
00555 
00556 void CObject::moveLeft(int amount, bool force)
00557 {
00558  if(amount <= 0)
00559   return;
00560 
00561  int y1 = y + bboxY1;
00562  int y2 = y + bboxY2;
00563 
00564  blockedr = false;
00565  // If it is forced don't check for collision
00566  if(force) {
00567   x -= amount;
00568   return;
00569  }
00570 
00571  if( y-amount < 0 )
00572   return;
00573 
00574  // If object isn't solid it won't be stopped anyway
00575  if(!solid)
00576  {
00577   blockedr = blockedl = false;
00578   blockedu = blockedd = false;
00579   x -= amount;
00580   return;
00581  }
00582 
00583  do
00584  {
00585   performCollisionsSameBox();
00586   if(!blockedl)
00587   {
00588    if(amount > (1<<STC))
00589    {
00590     x -= (1<<STC);
00591     moveSlopedTiles(getXMidPos()-64, y1, y2, -(1<<STC));
00592     amount -= (1<<STC);
00593    }
00594    else
00595    {
00596     x -= amount;
00597     moveSlopedTiles(getXMidPos()-64, y1, y2, -amount);
00598     amount = 0;
00599    }
00600   }
00601   else break;
00602  } while( amount > 0 );
00603 }
00604 
00605 void CObject::moveRight(int amount, bool force)
00606 {
00607  if(amount <= 0)
00608   return;
00609 
00610  int y1 = y + bboxY1;
00611  int y2 = y + bboxY2;
00612 
00613  blockedl = false;
00614  if(force) {
00615   x += amount;
00616   return;
00617  }
00618 
00619  if(!solid)
00620  {
00621   blockedr = blockedl = false;
00622   blockedu = blockedd = false;
00623   x += amount;
00624   return;
00625  }
00626 
00627  // process the walking on tiles
00628  do
00629  {
00630   performCollisionsSameBox();
00631   if(!blockedr)
00632   {
00633    if(amount > (1<<STC))
00634    {
00635     x += (1<<STC);
00636     moveSlopedTiles(getXMidPos()+64, y1, y2, (1<<STC));
00637     amount -= (1<<STC);
00638    }
00639    else
00640    {
00641     x += amount;
00642     moveSlopedTiles(getXMidPos()+64, y1, y2, amount);
00643     amount = 0;
00644    }
00645   }
00646   else break;
00647  } while( amount > 0 );
00648 }
00649 
00650 void CObject::moveUp(int amount)
00651 {
00652  if(amount <= 0)
00653   return;
00654 
00655  int y1 = y + bboxY1;
00656 
00657  if( y1-amount < 0 )
00658   return;
00659 
00660  if(!solid)
00661  {
00662   blockedr = blockedl = false;
00663   blockedu = blockedd = false;
00664   y -= amount;
00665   return;
00666  }
00667 
00668  do
00669  {
00670   performCollisionsSameBox();
00671   if(!blockedu)
00672   {
00673    if(amount > (1<<STC))
00674    {
00675     y -= (1<<STC);
00676     amount -= (1<<STC);
00677    }
00678    else
00679    {
00680     y -= amount;
00681     amount = 0;
00682    }
00683   }
00684   else break;
00685  } while( amount > 0 );
00686 }
00687 
00688 void CObject::moveDown(int amount)
00689 {
00690  if(amount <= 0)
00691   return;
00692 
00693  blockedu = false;
00694 
00695  if(!solid)
00696  {
00697   blockedr = blockedl = false;
00698   blockedu = blockedd = false;
00699   y += amount;
00700   return;
00701  }
00702 
00703  do
00704  {
00705   performCollisionsSameBox();
00706   if(!blockedd)
00707   {
00708    if(amount > (1<<STC))
00709    {
00710     y += (1<<STC);
00711     amount -= (1<<STC);
00712    }
00713    else
00714    {
00715     y += amount;
00716     amount = 0;
00717    }
00718   }
00719   else break;
00720  } while(amount > 0);
00721 }
00722 
00723 // This decreases the inertia we have of the object in X-direction.
00724 // It should be used for objects, where it must be assured, that the inertia can get
00725 // zero and not pass that limit
00726 void CObject::decreaseXInertia(int value)
00727 {
00728  if(xinertia < 0) {
00729   if(xinertia+value > 0) xinertia = 0;
00730   else xinertia += value;
00731  }
00732  else if(xinertia > 0) {
00733   if(xinertia-value < 0) xinertia = 0;
00734   else xinertia -= value;
00735  }
00736 }
00737 
00738 // handles inertia and friction for the X direction
00739 // (this is where the xinertia is actually applied to playx)
00740 void CObject::InertiaAndFriction_X()
00741 {
00742  const int friction_rate = 10;
00743 
00744  int dx=xinertia;
00745  // check first if the player is not blocked
00746  if( (!blockedr and dx>0) or (!blockedl and dx<0) )
00747   moveXDir(dx);
00748  else
00749   xinertia = 0;
00750 
00751  // and apply friction to xinertia
00752  // when pogoing apply friction till we get down to PFASTINCMAXSPEED
00753  // then stop the friction
00754  decreaseXInertia(friction_rate);
00755 }
00756 
00757 unsigned int CObject::getXPosition()
00758 { return x; }
00759 unsigned int CObject::getYPosition()
00760 { return y; }
00761 unsigned int CObject::getXLeftPos()
00762 { return x+bboxX1; }
00763 unsigned int CObject::getXRightPos()
00764 { return x+bboxX2; }
00765 unsigned int CObject::getXMidPos()
00766 { return x+(bboxX2-bboxX1)/2; }
00767 unsigned int CObject::getYUpPos()
00768 { return y+bboxY1; }
00769 unsigned int CObject::getYDownPos()
00770 { return y+bboxY2; }
00771 unsigned int CObject::getYMidPos()
00772 { return y+(bboxY2-bboxY1)/2; }
00773 
00774 // returns nonzero if object1 overlaps object2
00775 bool CObject::hitdetect(CObject &hitobject)
00776 {
00777  unsigned int rect1x1, rect1y1, rect1x2, rect1y2;
00778  unsigned int rect2x1, rect2y1, rect2x2, rect2y2;
00779  
00780  // get the bounding rectangle of the first object
00781  rect1x1 = x + bboxX1;
00782  rect1y1 = y + bboxY1;
00783  rect1x2 = x + bboxX2;
00784  rect1y2 = y + bboxY2;
00785  
00786  // get the bounding rectangle of the second object
00787  rect2x1 = hitobject.x + hitobject.bboxX1;
00788  rect2y1 = hitobject.y + hitobject.bboxY1;
00789  rect2x2 = hitobject.x + hitobject.bboxX2;
00790  rect2y2 = hitobject.y + hitobject.bboxY2;
00791  
00792  // find out if the rectangles overlap
00793  if ((rect1x1 <= rect2x1) && (rect1x2 <= rect2x1)) return false;
00794  if ((rect1x1 >= rect2x2) && (rect1x2 >= rect2x2)) return false;
00795  if ((rect1y1 <= rect2y1) && (rect1y2 <= rect2y1)) return false;
00796  if ((rect1y1 >= rect2y2) && (rect1y2 >= rect2y2)) return false;
00797  
00798  return true;
00799 }
00800 
00801 /**
00802  * \brief this new type of hit detection only checks if the foe touches something that has that property
00803  * \param Property The Tile Property we are looking
00804  * \return true if detection worked with that tile having the property, else false
00805  */
00806 bool CObject::hitdetectWithTileProperty(Uint16 Property)
00807 {
00808  unsigned int rect1x1, rect1y1, rect1x2, rect1y2;
00809  Uint16 behavior;
00810 
00811  // get the bounding rectangle of the first object
00812  rect1x1 = x + bboxX1;
00813  rect1y1 = y + bboxY1;
00814  rect1x2 = x + bboxX2;
00815  rect1y2 = y + bboxY2;
00816 
00817  std::vector<CTileProperties> &Tile = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00818 
00819  behavior = Tile[mp_Map->getPlaneDataAt(1, rect1x1, rect1y1)].behaviour;
00820  if(behavior == Property) return true;
00821 
00822  behavior = Tile[mp_Map->getPlaneDataAt(1, rect1x2, rect1y1)].behaviour;
00823  if(behavior == Property) return true;
00824 
00825  behavior = Tile[mp_Map->getPlaneDataAt(1, rect1x1, rect1y2)].behaviour;
00826  if(behavior == Property) return true;
00827 
00828  behavior = Tile[mp_Map->getPlaneDataAt(1, rect1x2, rect1y2)].behaviour;
00829  if(behavior == Property) return true;
00830 
00831  return false;
00832 }
00833 
00834 /**
00835  * processes falling of an object. Can be player or any other foe
00836  */
00837 void CObject::processFalling()
00838 {
00839  if(m_type == OBJ_MESSIE) return;
00840 
00841  // So it reaches the maximum of fallspeed
00842  if(!inhibitfall)
00843  {
00844   CPhysicsSettings &Physics = g_pBehaviorEngine->getPhysicsSettings();
00845 
00846   if( yinertia>0 && !onslope )
00847    falling = true;
00848   else
00849    falling = false;
00850 
00851   // In this case foe is jumping
00852   if(yinertia<0 && !blockedu)
00853   {
00854    moveUp(-yinertia);
00855    yinertia += Physics.fallspeed_increase;
00856    if(yinertia > 0) yinertia = 0;
00857   }
00858   else if(yinertia>=0 && !blockedd )
00859   {
00860    moveDown(yinertia);
00861    yinertia += Physics.fallspeed_increase;
00862   }
00863 
00864   // hit floor or ceiling? set inertia to zero
00865   if( (blockedd && yinertia>0) || (blockedu && yinertia<0) )
00866    yinertia = 0;
00867  }
00868  else
00869  {
00870   moveYDir(yinertia);
00871  }
00872 
00873  // sometimes, due to mistakes on the map, some foe are embedded into blocks!
00874  // In order to avoid, that they can't get out, pull them out of there!
00875 }
00876 
00877 void CObject::getShotByRay()
00878 {
00879  if( !m_invincible && HealthPoints>0)
00880  {
00881   if(HealthPoints>1 && g_pVideoDriver->getSpecialFXConfig())
00882    blink(10);
00883   HealthPoints--;
00884  }
00885 }
00886 
00887 // anything (players/enemies) occupying the map tile at [mpx,mpy] is killed
00888 void CObject::kill_intersecting_tile(int mpx, int mpy, CObject &theObject)
00889 {
00890   unsigned int xpix,ypix;
00891   unsigned int x, y;
00892   xpix = mpx<<CSF;
00893   ypix = mpy<<CSF;
00894 
00895   x = theObject.getXMidPos();
00896   y = theObject.getYUpPos();
00897   if (theObject.exists)
00898    if (xpix-(1<<CSF) <= x && xpix+(1<<CSF) >= x)
00899     if (ypix <= y && ypix+(1<<CSF) >= y)
00900     {
00901      theObject.kill();
00902      theObject.dontdraw = true;
00903     }
00904 }
00905 
00906 bool CObject::checkSolidR( int x1, int x2, int y1, int y2)
00907 {
00908  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00909 
00910  x2 += COLISION_RES;
00911 
00912  if( (x2>>STC) != ((x2>>CSF)<<TILE_S) )
00913   return false;
00914 
00915  // Check for right from the object
00916  if(solid)
00917  {
00918   for(int c=y1 ; c<=y2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
00919   {
00920    if(TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x2>>CSF, c>>CSF)].bleft)
00921     return true;
00922   }
00923 
00924   if(TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x2>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bleft)
00925    return true;
00926  }
00927 
00928  if( m_type == OBJ_PLAYER && solid )
00929  {
00930   if( x2 >= (int)((mp_Map->m_width-2)<<CSF) ) return true;
00931  }
00932  else
00933  {
00934   if( (Uint16)x2 > ((mp_Map->m_width)<<CSF) )
00935   {
00936    exists=false; // Out of map?
00937    return true;
00938   }
00939  }
00940 
00941  // This is a special case for foes which can turn around when they walk over an edge before they fall
00942  /*if(m_canturnaround && TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x1-(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup)
00943  {
00944   return true;
00945  }*/
00946 
00947  return false;
00948 }
00949 
00950 bool CObject::checkSolidL( int x1, int x2, int y1, int y2)
00951 {
00952  bool vorticon = (g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() <= 3);
00953  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00954 
00955  if( vorticon && ( (x1>>STC) != ((x1>>CSF)<<TILE_S) ) )
00956   return false;
00957 
00958  x1 -= COLISION_RES;
00959 
00960  // Check for right from the object
00961  if(solid)
00962  {
00963   for(int c=y1 ; c<=y2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
00964   {
00965    if(TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x1>>CSF, c>>CSF)].bright)
00966     return true;
00967   }
00968 
00969   if(TileProperty[mp_Map->at(x1>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bright)
00970    return true;
00971  }
00972 
00973  if( m_type == OBJ_PLAYER && solid )
00974  {
00975   if( x1 <= (2<<CSF) ) return true;
00976  }
00977  else
00978  {
00979   if( x1 == 0 )
00980   {
00981    exists=false; // Out of map?
00982    return true;
00983   }
00984  }
00985 
00986  // This is a special case for foes which can turn around when they walk over an edge before they fall
00987  /*if(m_canturnaround && TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2+(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup)
00988  {
00989   return true;
00990  }*/
00991 
00992  return false;
00993 }
00994 
00995 bool CObject::checkSolidU(int x1, int x2, int y1)
00996 {
00997  bool vorticon = (g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() <= 3);
00998  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
00999 
01000  y1 -= COLISION_RES;
01001 
01002  // Check for sloped tiles here. They must be handled differently
01003  if(!vorticon && solid)
01004  {
01005   char blocked;
01006   for(int c=x1 ; c<=x2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
01007   {
01008    blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(c>>CSF, y1>>CSF)].bdown;
01009    if( blocked >= 2 && blocked <= 7 && checkslopedU(c, y1, blocked))
01010     return true;
01011   }
01012   blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2-(1<<STC))>>CSF, y1>>CSF)].bdown;
01013   if( blocked >= 2 && blocked <= 7 && checkslopedU(x2-(1<<STC), y1, blocked ))
01014    return true;
01015  }
01016 
01017  if( ((y1+COLISION_RES)>>STC) != (((y1+COLISION_RES)>>CSF)<<TILE_S)  )
01018   return false;
01019 
01020  // Check for right from the object
01021  if(solid)
01022  {
01023   for(int c=x1 ; c<=x2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
01024   {
01025    char blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(c>>CSF, y1>>CSF)].bdown;
01026 
01027    if(blocked)
01028    {
01029     if(vorticon)
01030      return true;
01031     else if(blocked == 1)
01032      return true;
01033    }
01034   }
01035  }
01036 
01037  if( y1 <= ( ((m_type == OBJ_PLAYER) ? 2 : 1)<<CSF) )
01038   return true;
01039 
01040  return false;
01041 }
01042 
01043 bool CObject::checkSolidD( int x1, int x2, int y2 )
01044 {
01045  bool vorticon = (g_pBehaviorEngine->getEpisode() <= 3);
01046  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperty = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties();
01047 
01048  y2 += COLISION_RES;
01049 
01050  // Check for sloped tiles here. They must be handled different
01051  if(!vorticon && solid)
01052  {
01053   char blocked;
01054 
01055   for(int c=x1 ; c<=x2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
01056   {
01057    blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(c>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bup;
01058    if( blocked >= 2 && blocked <= 7 && checkslopedD(c, y2, blocked))
01059    //if( blocked )
01060     return true;
01061   }
01062   blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2)>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bup;
01063   if( blocked >= 2 && blocked <= 7 && checkslopedD(x2, y2, blocked ))
01064   //if( blocked )
01065    return true;
01066  }
01067 
01068  if( (y2>>STC) != ((y2>>CSF)<<TILE_S) )
01069   return false;
01070 
01071  // Check for down from the object
01072  if(solid)
01073  {
01074   char blocked;
01075   for(int c=x1 ; c<=x2 ; c += COLISION_RES)
01076   {
01077    blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at(c>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bup;
01078 
01079    if(blocked)
01080    {
01081     if( blocked < 2 || blocked > 7 )
01082      return true;
01083    }
01084   }
01085 
01086   blocked = TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2-(1<<STC))>>CSF, y2>>CSF)].bup;
01087   if(blocked)
01088   {
01089    if( blocked < 2 || blocked > 7 )
01090     return true;
01091   }
01092  }
01093 
01094  if( (Uint32)y2 > ((mp_Map->m_height)<<CSF) )
01095   exists=false; // Out of map?
01096 
01097  // This is a special case for foes which can turn around when they walk over an edge before they fall
01098  if(m_canturnaround &&
01099   ( !TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x1-(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup ||
01100     !TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2+(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup ) )
01101  {
01102   blockedl = TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x2+(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup;
01103   blockedr = TileProperty[mp_Map->at((x1-(1<<STC))>>CSF, (y2+(1<<STC))>>CSF)].bup;
01104 
01105   return true;
01106  }
01107 
01108  return false;
01109 }
01110 
01111 /* Special slope function for galaxy maps
01112  0 Jump through  1 Flat bottom
01113  2 Bottom-> Middle  3 Middle -> top
01114  4 Bottom -> top  5 Middle -> bottom
01115  6 Top -> middle  7 Top -> bottom
01116  */
01117 bool CObject::checkslopedU( int c, int y1, char blocked)
01118 {
01119  int yb1, yb2;
01120 
01121  if( blocked == 2 )
01122   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 256;
01123  else if( blocked == 3 )
01124   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 0;
01125  else if( blocked == 4 )
01126   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 0;
01127  else if( blocked == 5 )
01128   yb1 = 256, yb2 = 512;
01129  else if( blocked == 6 )
01130   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 256;
01131  else if( blocked == 7 )
01132   yb1 = 0, yb2 = 512;
01133  else
01134   yb1 = 512, yb2 = 512;
01135 
01136  int dy = ((yb2-yb1-32)*(c%512))/512;
01137  int yh = yb1 + dy;
01138 
01139  return ( (y1%512) < yh );
01140 }
01141 
01142 /* Spezial slope function for galaxy maps
01143 0 Fall through  1 Flat
01144 2 Top -> Middle  3 Middle -> bottom
01145 4 Top -> bottom  5 Middle -> top
01146 6 Bottom -> middle 7 Bottom -> top
01147 8 Unused    9 Deadly, can't land on in God mode
01148  */
01149 bool CObject::checkslopedD( int c, int y2, char blocked)
01150 {
01151  int yb1, yb2;
01152 
01153  getSlopePointsLowerTile(blocked, yb1, yb2);
01154 
01155  int dy = ((yb2-yb1)*(c%512))/512;
01156  int yh = yb1 + dy;
01157 
01158  return ( y2%512 > yh );
01159 }

01162 // Just kills the object
01163 void CObject::kill()
01164 {
01165  if ( exists && canbezapped )
01166  {
01167   HealthPoints = 0;
01168   dead = true;
01169  }
01170 }

01174  *     Normally this happens, when an enemy gets shot and can get
01175  *     multiple hits.
01176  * \param frametime amount of drawn blinking frames during the blitting.
01177  *      Every draw cycle performs one
01178  */
01179 void CObject::blink(Uint16 frametime)

01199  m_Action.setActionFormat(m_ActionBaseOffset + 30*m_ActionNumber);

01203 {
01204  if(m_ActionNumber == ActionNumber) return;
01205  setActionForce(ActionNumber);

01208 // This new function will setup the sprite based on the Action format
01209 void CObject::processActionRoutine()
01210 {
01211 
01212  if(m_direction == LEFT)
01213   sprite = m_Action.Left_sprite-124;
01214  else if(m_direction == RIGHT)
01215   sprite = m_Action.Right_sprite-124;
01216 
01217  calcBouncingBoxes();
01218 
01219  if( m_ActionTicker > m_Action.Delay )
01220  {
01221   if( m_Action.Delay != 0 && m_Action.Next_action != 0 )
01222    m_Action.setNextActionFormat();
01223   m_ActionTicker = 0;
01224  }
01225  else
01226   m_ActionTicker+=2;
01227 }
01228 
01229 ////
01230 // For drawing
01231 ////
01232 
01233 // Functions finally draws the object also considering that there could be a masked
01234 // or priority tile!
01235 void CObject::draw()
01236 {
01237  if( sprite == BLANKSPRITE )
01238   return;
01239 
01240  CSprite &Sprite = g_pGfxEngine->getSprite(sprite);
01241     SDL_Surface *sfc = g_pVideoDriver->getBlitSurface();
01242 
01243  scrx = (x>>STC)-mp_Map->m_scrollx;
01244  scry = (y>>STC)-mp_Map->m_scrolly;
01245 
01246  SDL_Rect gameres = g_pVideoDriver->getGameResolution();
01247 
01248  if(scry < gameres.w && scry < gameres.h && exists)
01249  {
01250   if(m_blinktime > 0)
01251   {
01252    Sprite.drawBlinkingSprite( sfc, scrx, scry );
01253    m_blinktime--;
01254   }
01255   else
01256    Sprite.drawSprite( sfc, scrx, scry );
01257   hasbeenonscreen = true;
01258  }
01259 }
01260 
01261 ///
01262 // Cleanup Routine
01263 ///
01264 CObject::~CObject() {
01265  if(m_number_of_objects > 0)
01266   m_number_of_objects--;
01267 }
